question: A simple pendulum has a period of 2 seconds on Earth. If this pendulum is taken to a planet with half the gravitational acceleration of Earth, what will be its new period?
solution: The period of a simple pendulum is given by the formula T = 2π√(L/g), where L is the length of the pendulum and g is the gravitational acceleration. If g is reduced by half, the period will increase by a factor of √2. Since the original period was 2 seconds, the new period will be 2√2 seconds.
